instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01949 stuck on 5V after liquid
threads.message:
3 of the 4 tb ports working "normaly, but stuck on 5v
1 the front left side starting the amp meter all time again

i found liquid problem under R3107 Pin 2, there was a big number in diode mode
I scratched the mainboard there and found a via. so i soldered a new resistor and a jumper wire to pin 48 U3100 and the via
now in diode mode is 0.566, should be ok

but still this port starts the amp meter all time from the beginning, all other ports ok but stuck on 5V

i replaced noe the u3100, no all ports normaly working but all stuck on 5 V and 400mA

PP3V3_G3H is 3.3V
PPBUS_G3H is 12.26V 

I checked all connectoins on J3300_CXT, the mac USB c meter shows ok as well

DZ3300_CXT and DZ3303_CXT I had a the feeling that they are not so nice and i pulled them out but no change without them

need some help please

threads.title: 820-01949 stuck on 5V after liquid
threads.message:
found here a hint
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/a2251-820-01949-a-no-power.63508/[/URL]

checked R3108/09 and found under R3109 pin2 korosion. will change and report back

threads.title: 820-01949 stuck on 5V after liquid
threads.message: ok, replaced but nothing changed R3109/08 has now on Pin 2  .528

threads.title: 820-01949 stuck on 5V after liquid
threads.message:
no idea...

PPDCIN_G3H is 5V, 
PP3V3_G3H is 3.3V
PPBUS_G3H is 12.26V 

400mA

its still without  DZ3300_CXT and DZ3303_CXT

threads.title: 820-01949 stuck on 5V after liquid
threads.message: Did you try DFU mode?

threads.title: 820-01949 stuck on 5V after liquid
threads.message:
yes, but all i do i dont get into the DFU mode
maybe its a DFU mode because i have 5.19V and 0A, 
after disconnecting the TB-Cable it start to draw 0.400A like before

but in the "DFU" mode i dont see the device on the master Mac

threads.title: 820-01949 stuck on 5V after liquid
threads.message:
found under U3060 one leg missing because of corrosion

i have a programmer and the same part from a a1708 

from where i can get the data to flash?

threads.title: 820-01949 stuck on 5V after liquid
threads.message:
thanks, i flashed that and soldered back
still 5V and 400mA
but now i can "see" it in dfu mode already.

but reviving device stucks on 1/3 of the way, while 5.11V and 0.375A

need realy help

threads.title: 820-01949 stuck on 5V after liquid
threads.message: ening up with this (reviving)

threads.title: 820-01949 stuck on 5V after liquid
threads.message:
in the repair wiki i found
[URL unfurl="true"]https://repair.wiki/w/A2251_2020_13%22_MacBook_Pro[/URL]
...PPBUS_G3H ~12.28–12.35 V = T2 communication issue with the ISL9240. The likely cause for this is the device is stuck in DFU mode due to corrupt T2 firmware or a failed CD3217. Proceed to repair steps below for corrupt T2 firmware. ...

and my  PPBUS_G3H is 12.26V  but i dont find the T2 firmware repai steps below...

would be great to save the date from this board

threads.title: 820-01949 stuck on 5V after liquid
threads.message: thanks for the A2251 T2 unlock Data. What can I do with this?

threads.title: 820-01949 stuck on 5V after liquid
threads.message:
thanks. I will report back after that.

Is there any other step needful? or only backup the T2 Rom and flash it with your file?

threads.title: 820-01949 stuck on 5V after liquid
threads.message:
Nothing more.
Just be sure to use 1.8V adapter to read/write the chip.

threads.title: 820-01949 stuck on 5V after liquid
threads.message:
I flashed your file into a new chip, soldered it on the board.
then i had 5V and about 200mA seems to be in DFU mode but in configurater not to "see"
so i flashed the backup into a another new chip and soldered this back
after that same like yesterday, 0,400 in DFU 0,200 in DFU to "see" but stuck in the revive prozess 

what i did wrong with your file?

threads.title: 820-01949 stuck on 5V after liquid
threads.message: Try to write that file in the new chip.

threads.title: 820-01949 stuck on 5V after liquid
threads.message: i tryed that but the same result, 5.15V 0.200A but DFU on the master not to "see"

threads.title: 820-01949 stuck on 5V after liquid
threads.message: I just see on the board there is missing R4710. is this all time so or i blow it away? I dont have another board for check this, in the schematics no advise to find

threads.title: 820-01949 stuck on 5V after liquid
threads.message:
no, found some pictures in the internet but there is no resistor. It represents (R4710-4715) the board ID

tryed again to solder the soc rom with your datafile, now it shows me the dfu
started to revive the machine but same result, stuck on 1/3 and switches from 0200A to 0380 A 5.11V
but now its all time in the DFU mode, not needfull to press the key kombinations, i think that means the T2 rom file is working

threads.title: 820-01949 stuck on 5V after liquid
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H_SSD0 is 12.22
SSD0_VR_2V5_EN = 0V

I measure with the scope the I2C"4" (I2C_PWR_SCL/SDA) but this is only 1.82V seems no try of communication there, in diode mode both have 0.454

threads.title: 820-01949 stuck on 5V after liquid
threads.message:
Did you try both revive and restore options in DFU?
You can also try again with your backup.

threads.title: 820-01949 stuck on 5V after liquid
threads.message:
no only revive. the client needs the data.
restore cleans it up I think?

threads.title: 820-01949 stuck on 5V after liquid
threads.message:
Restore erases the SSD.
Sometime only that can fix the machine.

Client should understand he MUST take care about data.
People paid lot of many for these Apple bulshits, knowing already the SSD is not interchangeable.
Time Machine is must do option, when install the macOS.

threads.title: 820-01949 stuck on 5V after liquid
threads.message:
yes you are right. 

ok so I tried that revive and restore is the same result. both have just in the moment when the message comes installing system..   the drawing ampere jumps from 0.200 to 0.400 then after some time end it up with pictures I posted already

threads.title: 820-01949 stuck on 5V after liquid
threads.message:
SSD0_VR_2V5_EN = 0V 

is this not a part of the problem? 

what does the restore/revive needs to work? where does the ..installing the system... installing the system and which system.

threads.title: 820-01949 stuck on 5V after liquid
threads.message:
Many times SSD voltages come on in DFU revive, or restore.
Check diode mode to ground on SSD power rails and all big coils.
